intro: Graptophyllum versicolor, commonly known as the variable thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are finely divided and fern-like, contributing to its ornamental value. Graptophyllum versicolor is often found in moist, disturbed soils along stream banks and roadsides.
